alert.note: Alert for Brunswick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 11:06AM EDT until August 28 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Brunswick County in south central Virginia... * Until 215 PM EDT. * At 1106 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Up to 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Warfield and Dolphin. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
